components.label: Legal Description or metes and bounds
Legal Description or metes and bounds
Legal Description or metes and bounds

components.html:
List all known site investigation, risk assessment (including screening level risk assessment), remediation plan and confirmation of remediation reports comleted and directly supporting correspondence submitted (for subject site and affected parcel). 

List documents in order from newest to oldest.
components.label: Content
Stage 1 PSI information is included as listed in CSR Section 58 and any current applicable ministry protocols, guidelines, checklists, etc.
Stage 2 PSI information is included as listed in CSR Section 59 and any current applicable ministry protocols, guidelines, checklists, etc.
DSI information is included as listed in CSR Section 59 and any current applicable ministry protocols, guidelines, checklists, etc.
Indicate how reports assist understanding of site condition and remediation

components.html: If investigation reports are incomplete or if reports are titled differently or have a different scope than those listed above in accordance with the Contaminated Sites Regulation (i.e. PSI, DSI), complete Section 4.8 (Investigation or Interpretation Issues)
components.label: Content
Topography (Describe steepness, direction of slope and position of site in relation to surrounding land)
Stratigraphy (Describe depth and thickness, grain size, etc. of typical stratigraphic components and note depth to cemented or very compact materials, bedrock / refusal, etc.)
Hydrogeology (Describe groundwater levels, confining / semi-confining layers, flow velocity and hydraulic conductivity)
HTML
components.content: Surface water features (List name, direction and distance to nearest surface water bodies and the characteristics (e.g., relative size / flow) of the water body)

components.html: Describe land use / activities for each applicable area
components.label: Content
Proposed land use of subject site
Describe proposed land use / activities for subject site
Explain (e.g. applicable or excluded guidance, protocols or policies specific to the site)
More than one land use applies at this site
Specify additional land uses covered by the document (e.g. riparian areas, roadways, etc. include a diagram to clearly show the area(s) with different standards)
Protocol 2 numerical standards have been applied
Identify the substance(s) and provide rationale for application of the site-specific numerical standard.
Protocol 4 local background concentrations in soil have been applied
Identify the substance(s) and provide rationale for why the background concentration applies
Proposed land use is same as current
Explain (e.g. applicable or excluded guidance, protocols or policies specific to the site)

Protocol 2 site-specific standards have been applied
Identify the substance and provide rationale for application of the site-specific numerical standard.
Protocol 4 local background concentrations in soil have been applied
Identify the substance(s) and provide rationale for why the background concentration applies.
Attention: attach diagram if more than one land use applies
Explain (e.g. applicable or excluded guidance, protocols or policies specific to the site)
More than one land use applies at the affected parcel
Specify additional land uses covered by the document (e.g. riparian areas, roadways, etc. include a diagram to clearly show the area(s) with different standards)
Protocol 2 site-specific standards have been applied
Identify the substance(s) and provide rationale for application of the site-specific numerical standard

Identify the substance(s) and provide rationale for why the background concentration applies
Groundwater standards apply at the site
More than one groundwater standard applies
Protocol 9 local background concentrations in groundwater have been applied
Provide rationale for why the background concentration applies.

Provide rationale and supporting data to show compliance with Protocol 21 'Water Use Determination' where a specified groundwater use (DW, AW, IW or LW) has been determined not to apply. Provide explicit statements regarding the applicability of all water uses (DW, AW, IW and LW), as well as a description for every geological unit where an exemption from a specified water use is proposed to apply (add additional pages if necessary).
Surface water guidelines apply at the site
More than one surface water guideline applies
Vapour standards apply at the site

values.label: Agricultural, Urban park, Residential use (AL, PL, RL)

components.label: Include descriptions of assumptions for both current and future development of the site that the selected VAFs are based on.
More than one vapour standard applies
Sediment standard applies at the site

components.title: 4.5 Areas of Potential Environmental Concern (APEC) and Potential Contaminants of Concern (PCOC) Summary
components.label: Panel

components.html:
Stage 1 Preliminary Site Investigation (PSI) 

Provide reference to a figure showing onsite and offsite APECs and PCOCs associated with each APEC. Add additional entries as necessary.
components.label: Content

components.html: List individual substances or groups of substances and their Chemical Abstract Service Numbers as they appear in the applicable schedule of the CSR. Attach additional lists or tables as needed.
components.label: Content
APEC Description (Describe location in relation to process source, waste, fill, land use or activity, etc., giving rise to APEC and list products, chemicals, waste type)
PCOC(s) (List regulated substance(s) and/or analytical parameter(s))

components.title: 4.6 Areas of Environmental Concern (AEC) and Contaminants of Concern (COC) Summary
components.label: Panel

components.html:
Stage 2 Preliminary Site Investigation (PSI) 

Provide references to figure(s) showing the AEC and COC associated with each AEC in onsite and offsite soil, water, sediment and/or vapour. Sample locations and corresponding analytical results to be shown on each figure and in tabular form with comparison to applicable standards:
components.label: Content

components.html:
Detailed Site Investigation (DSI) 

Provide references to figures (plan and section), with contours, showing the specific lateral and vertical distribution of each contaminant of concern in onsite and offsite soil, sediment, water and vapour. Cross-sections to be longitudinal and transverse with respect to groundwater flow and include physical conditions (e.g. stratigraphy, water table etc.). Sample locations with corresponding analytical results to be shown on the figure and in tabular form with comparison to applicable standards:
components.label: Content
AEC (Use same #s as APECs in table above)
Identify risk classification under Protocol 12. If application is risk-based, identify site type.
There is evidence that one or more substances has migrated or is likely to have migrated to a neighbouring property and is or is likely causing contamination of the neighbouring property
Preferential pathways have been assessed (including assessment of all neighbouring underground utility rights-of-way)
Current offsite transport of contaminants from the site
Historical offsite transport of contaminants from the site
Offsite transport of contaminants from the site in the following media. Select all that apply:
Briefly describe the nature of and evidence for offsite migration (either known, suspected, or potential) and status of investigation / delineation.
The affected parcel(s) are categorized as:

values.label: Being aquatic habitat, as formally defined

components.title: 4.8 Investigation or Interpretation Issues to be Addressed
components.label: Panel

Identify any issues regarding investigations or interpretations if the PSI and DSI information may not satisfy the requirements of CSR Sections 58 and 59 and applicable protocols and guidance documents. Provide details if delineation is incomplete but a preapproval was not required. Give a brief summary of the scenario and describe how these issues will be addressed. Example scenarios: incomplete investigation due to inaccessible APEC; flow-through contamination; area wide contamination; remediation of part of a site; contaminants are a result of beneficial uses or; application of statistics to interpret data. Enter N/A if not applicable.

Includes quantitative human health and ecological risk assessment report information or screening level risk assessment under EMA, CSR and current applicable ministry protocols, guidelines, checklists
Includes CSR specified information for a Remediation Plan (see CSR S.1, 16, 47) and current applicable ministry protocols, guidelines, checklists, etc.
Includes CSR specified information (see CSR S.49) and any current applicable ministry protocols, guidelines, checklists for COR reports
Report(s) in accordance to guidelines other than CSR.
Indicate how reports assist understanding of conditions and/or remediation

components.html: If Reports have an incomplete or different scope than those listed above, in accordance with CSR, complete Section 5.6 - Outstanding Remediation Issues.
components.label: Content

components.html: Describe all aspects of remediation including regulatory actions and activities to comply with numerical and/or risk-based standards
components.label: Content
Regulatory (e.g. Notification of Independent Remediation, Approval in Principle, Certificate of Compliance, Determination, Restrictive Covenant etc.)

If an Approval in Principle was previously issued for the site and the site is now eligible for a Certificate of Compliance, list the conditions of the AiP and document how they were achieved during site remediation.
Remediation to comply with numerical standards:
Describe method of remediation, with details on excavation / disposal of soil (including volumes), and remediation treatment technologies used.
Remediation to comply with risk-based standards:

Describe risk management / exposure reduction methods intended or implemented and indicate the status of any measures.(e.g., physical/engineering risk controls,  monitoring, capping or barriers to exposure; institutional risk controls: registration of restrictive covenants, financial security, etc.)
Engineered works were installed at the site boundaries to prevent recontamination.

components.html: Provide reference to signed and stamped design drawings completed by a professional engineer.
components.label: Content
Environmental medium assessed. Select all that apply. (If this SOSC is to support a Negative Determination Application, select N/A)
Remediated to the following standard (proposed or completed)
Remediated to the following standard (proposed or completed)
Remediated to the following standard (proposed or completed)
Remediated to the following standard (proposed or completed)
Remediated to the following standard (proposed or completed)

components.title: 5.4 Summary of Contaminant Treatment or Removal
components.label: Panel

components.html:
Identify and describe all contamination remediated through on-site treatment or removed from the site. Ensure Part 6 - Summary of Soil Management is completed regarding the relocation of waste and non-waste soil.

Provide references to figure(s) showing the lateral and vertical extent of any treated or removed contamination. Confirmatory sample locations and corresponding analytical results to be shown on each figure and in tabular form with comparison to applicable standards:
components.label: Content
Disposal location (indicate if treated on- site)

components.title: 5.5 Summary of Residual Contamination After Remediation
components.label: Panel

components.html:
Identify and describe all contamination remaining after the remediation described above has been implemented.

Provide reference to figure(s) showing residual contamination
components.label: Content
Vertical extent of contamination (m; specify depth range)
Risk-based standards met using risk controls

Identify any issues with remediation or interpretation. Briefly describe if the remediation or remediation report(s) have a different scope than what is listed in section 5.1, in accordance with the CSR.(e.g., destroyed wells, completion of delineation following demolition or proposed work at a later stage of remediation). Enter N/A if not applicable.
Soil was relocated from the subject site
Waste soil relocated to a site authorized under Part 2 of the Environmental Management Act or an Approval in Principle to receive waste soil
Non-waste soil relocated to a receiving site
Legal Description or metes and bounds

components.label: Recommendation under Protocol 6
Direct-to-ministry application

components.title: 7.1 Certification Document and Summary Recommendation
components.label: Panel

components.html: Based on my review of the documentation listed in Part 3 of this Summary of Site Condition
components.label: Content
-in comparison to the requirements and expectations of the Environmental Management Act, Contaminated Sites Regulation, protocols and supporting ministry policy and guidance
components.content: -in comparison to the requirements and expectations of the Environmental Management Act, Contaminated Sites Regulation, protocols and supporting ministry policy and guidance

components.label: and the confirmations and other statements made in this Part
components.content: -and the confirmations and other statements made in this Part

components.html: recommend that the director consider issuance of the following:
components.label: Content

values.label: A Determination under section 44 of EMA
An AiP under section 53 (1) of EMA
A CoC under section 53(3) of EMA
A Site Risk Reclassification under Protocol 12
Other Recommendation under section 7.1 of the CSR
Negative (a determination by a director under section 44 of the Act that a site is not a contaminated site)
Positive (a determination by a director under section 44 of the Act that a site is a contaminated site)

components.label: In my opinion the site does not meet the definition of a contaminated site in accordance with the CSR based on the following:

values.label: CSR Schedule 2 activities are known or suspected to have occurred at the subject site. A preliminary site investigation addressing all identified areas of potential environmental concern (APECs) and potential contaminants of concern (PCOCs) was completed. No substances were identified in concentrations exceeding the standards prescribed in CSR Schedules 3.1-3.4. All evaluated PCOCs are listed in Schedule B of the draft Determination.

No Schedule 2 activities have occurred at the subject site. A preliminary site investigation addressing all identified areas of potential environmental concern (APECs) and potential contaminants of concern (PCOCs) was completed. No substances were identified in concentrations exceeding the standards prescribed in CSR Schedules 3.1-3.4. All evaluated PCOCs are listed in Schedule B of the draft Determination.

Other available information was provided and reviewed and no substances were identified in concentrations exceeding the standards prescribed in CSR Schedules 3.1-3.4. All evaluated PCOCs are listed in Schedule B of the draft Determination.

components.label: Describe the information provided and how it justifies a negative determination
In my opinion the site meets the definition of a contaminated site in accordance with the CSR based on the following:

values.label: A preliminary site investigation addressing all identified areas of potential environmental concern (APECs) and potential contaminants of concern (PCOCs) was completed. Substances were identified in concentrations exceeding the standards prescribed in CSR Schedules 3.1-3.4. All identified COCs are listed in Schedule B of the draft Determination.

Other available information was provided and reviewed, and substances were identified in concentrations exceeding the standards prescribed in CSR Schedules 3.1-3.4. All identified COCs are listed in Schedule B of the draft Determination.

components.label: Describe the information provided and how it justifies a positive determination

components.html: For a recommendation for an Approval in Principle
components.label: Content

The site is classified as non-high risk under Protocol 12 or the director has issued a preapproval under Protocol 6 allowing the application to be submitted with the recommendation of an Approved Professional.

A Preliminary Site Investigation addressing all identified areas of potential environmental concern (APECs) and potential contaminants of concern (PCOCs) was completed. One or more substances were identified at concentrations exceeding applicable standards or criteria in CSR Schedules 3.1, 3.2, 3.3 or 3.4

A detailed site investigation addressing the locations and extent of all identified areas of environmental concern (AECs) and contaminants of concern (COCs) was completed and forms the basis of a remediation plan or risk assessment, OR;
An incomplete detailed site investigation forms the basis of a remediation plan or risk assessment (details were provided in Section 4.8).
When this summary of site condition was prepared

values.label: A remediation plan had been prepared that includes remediation of all identified contamination to either CSR numerical or risk-based standards, OR
values.value: A remediation plan had been prepared that includes remediation of all identified contamination to either CSR numerical or risk-based standards, OR

values.label: A remediation plan had been prepared that includes remediation of a specified area of contamination to either CSR numerical or risk-based standards (with issuance of a Protocol 6 preapproval or sufficient rationale was provided to identify area-wide or flow-through contamination) OR
values.value: A remediation plan had been prepared that includes remediation of a specified area of contamination to either CSR numerical or risk-based standards (with issuance of a Protocol 6 preapproval or sufficient rationale was provided to identify area-wide or flow-through contamination) OR

values.label: A remediation plan had been prepared that includes supplementary site investigation to complete full site delineation and remediation of all contamination to either CSR numerical or risk-based standards.
values.value: A remediation plan had been prepared that includes supplementary site investigation to complete full site delineation and remediation of all contamination to either CSR numerical or risk-based standards.

values.label: A schedule with estimated dates for implementing remediation was provided.

components.html: For a recommendation for a Certificate of Compliance
components.label: Content

The site is classified as non-high risk under Protocol 12 or the director has issued a preapproval under Protocol 6 allowing the application to be submitted with the recommendation of an Approved Professional.

A preliminary site investigation addressing all identified areas of potential environmental concern (APECs) and potential contaminants of concern (PCOCs) was completed. One or more substances were identified at concentrations exceeding applicable standards or criteria in CSR Schedules 3.1, 3.2, 3.3 or 3.4

A detailed site investigation addressing the locations and extent of all identified areas of environmental concern (AECs) and contaminants of concern (COCs) was completed and was the basis for remediation of the site, OR

An incomplete detailed site investigation (due to issuance of a Protocol 6 preapproval, or justification to not delineate or remediate the entire extent of contamination) was the basis for remediation of the site.
When this summary of site condition was prepared contaminants identified in investigation and risk assessment reports had been remediated to CSR numerical concentration or risk-based standards.

components.html: For a recommendation for a Site Risk Reclassification
components.label: Content

values.label: The site is classified as risk-managed high risk under Protocol 12.
The site is classified as non-high risk under Protocol 12.

components.title: 7.2 Substances Remediated and Standards or Criteria Applied
components.label: Panel
Substances Remediated in following media. Select all that apply.

components.html: Use specific compound names as listed in the Contaminated Sites Regulation Schedules.
components.label: Content

components.html: Substances remediated in soil to meet the following standards:
components.label: Content
Land use the substance(s) have been remediated to in soil. Select all that apply.

components.html: Substances remediated in water to meet the following standards:
components.label: Content
Water use the substance(s) have been remediated to. Select all that apply.

components.html: Substances remediated in vapour to meet the following standards:
components.label: Content
Vapour use the substances have been remediated to. Select all that apply.

components.html: Substances remediated in sediment to meet the following standards:
components.label: Content
Sediment use the substances have been remediated to. Select all that apply.
Provide details on the media and relevant use(s)

components.html: The Director may accept the recommendations of an Approved Professional based on the Approved Professional's review of investigation, risk assessment, and/or remediation reports, with the understanding that. Select all that apply.
components.label: Content

As of the date of signing of this report, the Approved Professional is a member in good standing of the Roster of Approved Professionals, as maintained by the ministry, and a member of the Contaminated Sites Approved Professionals Society (CSAP Society);

The Approved Professional signing this Summary of Site Condition has reviewed Table 1, Protocol 6 for Contaminated Sites (Applications with Approved Professional Recommendations and Preapprovals) and confirm that the application for contaminated sites services may be processed in the manner for non-high risk sites under the Roster of Approved Professionals process;

The site has been satisfactorily investigated for all areas of (potential) environmental concern and (potential) contaminants of concern to determine the lateral and vertical extents of contamination; OR
The site has been investigated to the extent reasonably possible for all areas of (potential) environmental concern and (potential) contaminants of concern;
The submitted documentation meets the requirements of Sections 1, 47, 49, 58 and 59 of the CSR;
The Screening Level Risk Assessment meets the requirements of Protocol 13;

The submitted remediation plan, if implemented in accordance with the specified conditions imposed in its draft Schedule 'B' of the AiP, will result in the site being remediated in accordance with the applicable standards of the CSR and the HWR;
It is feasible to implement all provisions of the Remediation Plan and to achieve its objectives, and the conditions of the AIP, in accordance with the proposed schedule;
The confirmation of remediation report meets the requirements of section 49 (2) of the CSR;
The site has been satisfactorily remediated in accordance with section 53 (3) of the EMA and section 49(2) of the CSR, in accordance with applicable standards as identified in the draft COC;
Contamination exists beyond the legal lot boundaries

values.label: The off-site portion(s) of the site has/have been satisfactorily remediated in accordance with section 53 (3) of the EMA and section 49(2) of the CSR and makes up part of this application, OR
A remediation plan, in accordance with requirements of the CSR, sections 1 and 47, has been prepared and application has been made for an AiP for the off-site portions;

components.label: Engineered works are required to prevent recontamination of the site. A signed and stamped design drawing has been provided by a professional engineer for works installed at site boundaries to prevent recontamination of the site. The signatory need not be the Approved Professional signing below.
In accordance with section 15 (5) of the CSR, the subject site is a contaminated site under section 44(1) of the Environmental Management Act;

components.html: For a Protocol Approval or Other Recommendation
components.label: For Other Recommendation or Protocol Approvals
The submitted documentation is in accordance with the requirements outlined in the relevant director's protocol or ministry guidance.

components.html: The opinions, advice and recommendations expressed in this Summary of Site Condition are made in accordance with generally accepted principles and practices as recognized by members of the applicable profession or discipline practicing at the same time and in the same or similar locations. This Summary of Site Condition does not provide a legal opinion or guarantee regarding compliance with applicable laws.
components.label: Content

components.title: 7.3 Arm's Length Review
components.label: Panel
An arms length review was completed.
An arms length review was completed for the following recommendations in support of an application to a director. Select all that apply.

values.label: An Approval in Principle based on remediation to numerical standards or a screening level risk assessment where there is offsite migration at the site.
An Approval in Principle based on a risk assessment (other than a screening level risk assessment) and remediation to risk-based standards.
A Certificate of Compliance based on remediation to numerical standards or a screening level risk assessment where there is offsite migration at the site.
A Certificate of Compliance based on a risk assessment (other than a screening level risk assessment) and remediation to risk-based standards.

Other application based on risk assessment or risk management (other than a screening level risk assessment) not otherwise described in any other row in this list, as required under a protocol signed by a director.

components.label: Signature of Approved Professional(s) who performed an arm's length review

components.html: Part 8 - Statement of Site Owner / Agent / Lessee
components.label: Content
There is evidence that one or more substances migrated or is likely to have migrated to a neighbouring property and is or is likely causing contamination of the neighbouring property
Owners of affected parcels have been formally notified

components.title: 8.2 Confirmations by Site Owner/Agent/Lessee Regarding Approved Professional
components.label: Panel
This is to acknowledge that as:

values.label: Agent on behalf of the Site owner
Agent on behalf of the responsible person

components.html:
as the Approved Professional(s) to review site investigation, risk assessment and remediation reports and to make submission and application with recommendations, as applicable

If signing as the agent of the owner or lessee, written consent from the owner or lessee authorizing signature of this Summary of Site Condition must be attached. Select all that apply.
components.label: Content
I agree to comply with the director's requirements for the site as documented in schedule B of the draft certification document.
I accept that if a risk assessment has been applied at the site, that the risk assessment is only valid as long as conditions at the site do not change.

I have undertaken reasonable inquiry into the previous ownership and uses of the property and to the best of my knowledge I have provided to the Approved Professional, information relevant to the investigation and remediation of the environmental condition of the site, in the preparation of this Summary of Site Condition.

I acknowledge that this Summary of Site Condition becomes a public document after it has been received and acknowledged by the director. Any party intending to purchase, lease, take a security interest in, or occupy the site may review this Summary of Site Document and any supporting documents to satisfy themselves with respect to the environmental condition of the site, and the extent of responsibility and liability that may arise from taking ownership, taking a security interest, or occupying the site.
I have made no modifications to this Summary of Site Condition except as allowed by the form
